headline: Xcel Energy (XEL): Net Margin Edges Down as Earnings Growth Trails Market Heading Into Earnings Season
summary: Xcel Energy (XEL) reported earnings growth of just 1.8% over the last year, slowing from its five-year average of 6% per year. Revenue is forecast to grow at 6.8% annually, while earnings are expected to rise 12.2% per year. Both figures trail the broader US market averages of 10.3% for revenue and 15.9% for earnings. Shares are currently trading at $81.17, notably above the estimated fair value of $65.98, and the company's net profit margin edged down to 13.5% from 13.7% a year earlier. The...
